intro: Euphrasia iinumae, commonly known as the Japanese eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. It has slender, branched stems and opposite, oval-shaped leaves. Euphrasia iinumae is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
